slide.title: Sevengill Shark ID Tool
slide.text: Sevengill Shark ID Tool Version 2.0 December 2015

slide.title: General ID Tips
slide.text: General ID Tips Most modern sharks have 5 gill slits and 2 dorsal fins A sevengill shark’s single dorsal fin is set far back along the spine towards the caudal fin, and is behind the pelvic fins

slide.title: General ID Tips
slide.text: General ID Tips Upper caudal fin is much longer than the lower, and is slightly notched near the tip Body and fins are covered in black & white spots

slide.title: Aquarium-specific ID Tips
slide.text: Aquarium-specific ID Tips Scars and nose rubs are not good differentiating features because they heal quickly As they age, spots getter lighter or darker (so also not a good differentiator) 8 of the 9 sevengill sharks at the Oregon Coast Aquarium are male (exception is Miss Piggy, the largest shark in the exhibit) 8 of the 9 sharks generally swim in a counter-clockwise direction (exception is Pongo)

slide.title: Miss Piggy
slide.text: Miss Piggy Largest shark in exhibit and only female (no claspers) Leading edge of R pectoral chopped from old wound Deep notch in L pectoral fin trailing edge Likes to swim close to divers Generally swims CCW Number 1

slide.title: Casper
slide.text: Casper Ghost image on belly Bottom of L pectoral is clean (no spots) unlike Lil’ D Constellation scar mid L side (old injury, faded) Generally swims CCW Number 2

slide.title: Spot
slide.text: Spot “thumbprint” center of chest between pectoral fins Note Pat also has this mark, but only Spot has “nipple” marks Bottom of 1st gill on L side is scarred from old wound Constellation arc of white scars on L side Arc instead of Casper’s constellation Generally swims CCW Number 3

slide.title: Pat
slide.text: Pat “thumbprint” center of chest between pectoral fins Note Spot also has this mark, but only Spot has “nipple” marks Notch out of trailing edge of R pectoral fin Clean, dark topside with few spots Generally swims CCW Pat

slide.title: Pongo
slide.text: Pongo Many dark spots on back Large dark smudge between R eye and nose Two “teardrops” under L eye Generally swims CW Crazy (swimmer)

slide.title: Lil’ D
slide.text: Lil’ D Blotchy back Two black spots on bottom L side of throat “ghost” image on chest (similar to Casper) Dark spot center of underside of L pectoral Single teardrop centered under both R & L eyes Black spot in front of gills on R side Generally swims CCW Little

slide.title: Bull
slide.text: Bull “salt & pepper beard” Two black spots above both R & L pectoral fin insertions Two black spots top of L pectoral fin Trailing edge of dorsal fin is quite ragged Generally swims CCW, but very irregular – sudden changes of direction Swims close to divers, loves to intimidate Hook ‘em Horns

slide.title: Mugs
slide.text: Mugs White spot in front of gills L side Two white spots above pectoral fin insertion L side Generally swims CCW Boxing

slide.title: Slash
slide.text: Slash Clean, white belly Small black dot in middle of gills on both R and L sides Tag scar on both sides of dorsal fin Generally swims CCW Karate Chop

slide.title: FIN
slide.text: FIN Special Thanks to Dave Cutter who generously provided many of these photos and videos
